title: Chicken Chile Enchiladas

frontmatter.title: Chicken Chile Enchiladas
ingredients: 1 lb Shredded Chicken (Rotisserie or Pressure Cooked)
1 can (15 oz) Red Enchilada Sauce (Hatch or homemade)
Sour Cream, Fresh Cilantro, and Sliced Jalapeños

kbSuggestions.title: Poultry low-temperature safety note
kbSuggestions.suggestion: This recipe references low-temperature cooking for poultry. Ensure it includes safe time/temperature notes (e.g., 60°C for 2 hours for pasteurization) or use higher temperatures to guarantee safety.

kbSuggestions.title: Maillard note: dry surface for browning
kbSuggestions.suggestion: For better browning, pat proteins dry and avoid overcrowding the pan; use a hot pan and enough fat to reach Maillard temperatures.

kbSuggestions.title: Recommend resting meat after high-heat cooking
kbSuggestions.suggestion: After searing/roasting, consider resting the meat for a few minutes (or longer for roasts) so juices redistribute and slices stay juicy.

kbSuggestions.title: Recommend tasting and seasoning
kbSuggestions.suggestion: Consider adding a step to taste and adjust seasoning (salt and acid) before serving.

kbSuggestions.title: Plating: add color or height when absent
kbSuggestions.suggestion: Consider a bright finishing garnish (herbs, citrus zest, pickles) or a crunchy element to add color and texture.
